bib_record.title: Measurement of neutron activation cross sections for energies up to 40 MeV for natural samples of Mg, Si, Ca, V, Cr, Cu and Zn

free_txt: The SF Cyclotron of the Institute for
Nuclear Study was used for the neutron irradiation.
The excitation functions of these rections were
obtained by using the least-aquares fitting (LSF) of
the cross-section values calculated with the
ALICE/LIVERMORE82 code, and also by using the SAND-II
and the NEUPAC unfolding codes with the initial values
derived from the LSF results and empirical reference
data ("Table of isotopes",7th ed.,1978,Lederer,Shirley)
Ge detector for gamma-ray spectrometry
Total error
The SF Cyclotron of the Institute for
Nuclear Study was used for the neutron irradiation.
Proton beams of energies at every 2.5 MeV
between 20 and 40 MeV were impinged to 1-mm-thick
(Ep=20 to 37.5MeV) and 2-mm-thick (Ep=40 MeV)Be
targets, which backed by a water coolant. The netrons
produced in the forward direction by this target system
were measured with a 51-mm-dia.x51-mm-long NE213
scintillator placed at about 1.1m from the target. The
measured spect. of the peak energy region was replaced
by calculated spectrum of which peak area had been
adjusted same as measured one (J,NIM/A,271,546,1988)
The activation samples except Si were
irradiated by turns for 1h at 20cm from the Be target.
The Si was irradiated for 20 min. These irradiations
were repeated for 9 proton energies.
Approved by Yoshitomo Uwamino
